intro: Myrsine thwaitesii, commonly known as the Philippine myrsine, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a small evergreen shrub characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with four petals, typically white or pale pink in color. Its fruits are small berries that turn red when mature, attracting various birds and small mammals. Myrsine thwaitesii is native to the Philippines and is often found in lowland and montane forests.
